https://youtu.be/w5KRawOXy4U?t=99 this doesn't make any sense when you look at them pouring the zinc right after this step. The plaster poured on the clay and casted plastic part would produce one side of a negative mold for the dinosaur. But then in the next shot, they're pouring zinc and aluminum molten over plaster that has the positive shape of half the dinosaur, not the negative. How did they get to that point, they missed showing a step?? I'm trying to do this and I can't figure out how they got from the plaster negative to a plaster positive half mold. Anyways love how it's made A++.

also Anyone know what this type of mold making is called? Specifically using aluminum pouring to make injection molds??

I have the same T-Rex

they skipped an important part here, after the "1/2 plaster mold" is made you cant just pour the metal into it or you will just have a positive copy of half a dinosaur in metal. they skipped a part where they replicated the half dinosaur in plaster to get a positive (not a negative) copy and THEN poured in the hot metal to have a negative master mold. its a big step between 1:53 and 1:55
